english_translation: Narrated from Muhammad ibn Sirin that Ubaydah was the arif (representative) of his people, and he distributed a stipend among them. One dirham was left over, so he ordered that they draw lots for it. A man approached him and said: 'This is not proper.' Ubaydah said: 'Did we not do this in our military campaigns?' The man replied: 'When you did that in the past, you distributed among the people first, then drew lots between them, so no one missed receiving a share. But if you draw lots for this one dirham, one person will take it while his companions get nothing.' Ubaydah said: 'You have spoken truthfully.' Then he ordered that something be purchased with that dirham, and then divided among them.
